trans-unit.source: Hadoop tutorial: Get started with Hadoop on Windows | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Hadoop tutorial: Get started with Hadoop on Windows | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get started with Hadoop in HDInsight. Learn how to provision Hadoop clusters on Windows, run a Hive query on data, and analyze output in Excel.
trans-unit.target: Get started with Hadoop in HDInsight. Learn how to provision Hadoop clusters on Windows, run a Hive query on data, and analyze output in Excel.

trans-unit.source: Hadoop tutorial: Get started with Hadoop and a Hive query in HDInsight on Windows
trans-unit.target: Hadoop tutorial: Get started with Hadoop and a Hive query in HDInsight on Windows

trans-unit.source: To help you learn Hadoop on Windows and start using HDInsight, this tutorial shows you how to run a Hive query on unstructured data in a Hadoop cluster and then analyze the results in Microsoft Excel.
trans-unit.target: To help you learn Hadoop on Windows and start using HDInsight, this tutorial shows you how to run a Hive query on unstructured data in a Hadoop cluster and then analyze the results in Microsoft Excel.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Get started with Hadoop in HDInsight on Windows</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Get started with Hadoop in HDInsight on Windows</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: What does this Hadoop tutorial accomplish?
trans-unit.target: What does this Hadoop tutorial accomplish?

trans-unit.source: Assume you have a large unstructured data set and you want to run a Hive query on it to extract some meaningful information.
trans-unit.target: Assume you have a large unstructured data set and you want to run a Hive query on it to extract some meaningful information.

trans-unit.source: That's exactly what we are going to do in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: That's exactly what we are going to do in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Here's how we achieve this:
trans-unit.target: Here's how we achieve this:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>"Hadoop tutorial: Create an account; provision a Hadoop cluster; submit a Hive query; analyze data in Excel.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>"Hadoop tutorial: Create an account; provision a Hadoop cluster; submit a Hive query; analyze data in Excel.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Watch a demo video of this tutorial to learn Hadoop on HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: Watch a demo video of this tutorial to learn Hadoop on HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Video of a first Hadoop tutorial: Submit a Hive query on a Hadoop cluster, and analyze results in Excel.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Video of a first Hadoop tutorial: Submit a Hive query on a Hadoop cluster, and analyze results in Excel.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Watch the Hadoop tutorial for HDInsight on YouTube</linkText><title></title></link>**
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Watch the Hadoop tutorial for HDInsight on YouTube</linkText><title></title></link>**

trans-unit.source: In conjunction with the general availability of Azure HDInsight, Microsoft also provides HDInsight Emulator for Azure, formerly known as Microsoft HDInsight Developer Preview.
trans-unit.target: In conjunction with the general availability of Azure HDInsight, Microsoft also provides HDInsight Emulator for Azure, formerly known as Microsoft HDInsight Developer Preview.

trans-unit.source: The Emulator targets developer scenarios and only supports single-node deployments.
trans-unit.target: The Emulator targets developer scenarios and only supports single-node deployments.

trans-unit.source: For information about using HDInsight Emulator, see <link><linkText>Get Started with the HDInsight Emulator[hdinsight-emulator]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about using HDInsight Emulator, see <link><linkText>Get Started with the HDInsight Emulator[hdinsight-emulator]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial for Hadoop on Windows, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial for Hadoop on Windows, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation computer with Office 2013 Professional Plus, Office 365 Pro Plus, Excel 2013 Standalone, or Office 2010 Professional Plus.
trans-unit.target: A workstation computer with Office 2013 Professional Plus, Office 365 Pro Plus, Excel 2013 Standalone, or Office 2010 Professional Plus.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Provision a Hadoop cluster
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Provision a Hadoop cluster

trans-unit.source: When you provision a cluster, you provision Azure compute resources that contain Hadoop and related applications.
trans-unit.target: When you provision a cluster, you provision Azure compute resources that contain Hadoop and related applications.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you provision an HDInsight version 3.2 cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you provision an HDInsight version 3.2 cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can also create Hadoop clusters for other versions.
trans-unit.target: You can also create Hadoop clusters for other versions.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters using custom options[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters using custom options[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For information about HDInsight versions and their SLAs, see <link><linkText>HDInsight component versioning</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about HDInsight versions and their SLAs, see <link><linkText>HDInsight component versioning</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To provision a Hadoop cluster
trans-unit.target: To provision a Hadoop cluster

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW, Click Data Analytics, and then click HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW, Click Data Analytics, and then click HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a Cluster Name, select Hadoop for the Cluster Type, and from the Cluster Operating System drop-down, select Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.
trans-unit.target: Enter a Cluster Name, select Hadoop for the Cluster Type, and from the Cluster Operating System drop-down, select Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if it is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear beside the cluster name if it is available.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enter cluster name and type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enter cluster name and type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, click the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, click the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click Resource Group to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.
trans-unit.target: Click Resource Group to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can click Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can click Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.

trans-unit.source: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.
trans-unit.target: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.

trans-unit.source: Click Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password.
trans-unit.target: Click Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Username and Cluster Login Password.

trans-unit.source: If you want to enable remote desktop on the cluster node, for Enable Remote Desktop, click Yes, and then specify the required values.
trans-unit.target: If you want to enable remote desktop on the cluster node, for Enable Remote Desktop, click Yes, and then specify the required values.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial does not require remote desktop so you can skip this.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial does not require remote desktop so you can skip this.

trans-unit.source: Click Select at the bottom to save the credentials configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select at the bottom to save the credentials configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide cluster credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide cluster credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Data Source to choose an existing data source for the cluster, or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: Click Data Source to choose an existing data source for the cluster, or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: When you provision a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight, you specify an Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When you provision a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight, you specify an Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: A specific Blob storage container from that account is designated as the default file system, like in the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS).
trans-unit.target: A specific Blob storage container from that account is designated as the default file system, like in the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS).

trans-unit.source: By default, the HDInsight cluster is provisioned in the same data center as the storage account you specify.
trans-unit.target: By default, the HDInsight cluster is provisioned in the same data center as the storage account you specify.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.

trans-unit.source: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts from all your subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Set this to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: Set this to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: Select storage account / Create New: Click Select storage account to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select storage account / Create New: Click Select storage account to browse and select an existing storage account you want to associate with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Or, click Create New to create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Or, click Create New to create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.
trans-unit.target: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.

trans-unit.source: Location: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.
trans-unit.target: Location: The geographic region that the storage account is in, or will be created in.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the data source configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the data source configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Set the number of worker nodes that you need for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.
trans-unit.target: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown within the blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the node pricing configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the node pricing configuration.

trans-unit.source: On the New HDInsight Cluster blade, ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then click Create.
trans-unit.target: On the New HDInsight Cluster blade, ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then click Create.

trans-unit.source: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.
trans-unit.target: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.

trans-unit.source: While provisioning
trans-unit.target: While provisioning

trans-unit.source: Provisioning complete
trans-unit.target: Provisioning complete

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.
trans-unit.target: Once the provisioning completes, click the tile for the cluster from the Startboard to launch the cluster blade.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Run sample data from the portal
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Run sample data from the portal

trans-unit.source: A successfully provisioned HDInsight cluster provides a query console that includes a Getting Started gallery to run samples directly from the portal.
trans-unit.target: A successfully provisioned HDInsight cluster provides a query console that includes a Getting Started gallery to run samples directly from the portal.

trans-unit.source: You can use the samples to learn how to work with HDInsight by walking through some basic scenarios.
trans-unit.target: You can use the samples to learn how to work with HDInsight by walking through some basic scenarios.

trans-unit.source: These samples come with all the required components, such as the data to analyze and the queries to run on the data.
trans-unit.target: These samples come with all the required components, such as the data to analyze and the queries to run on the data.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the samples in the Getting Started gallery, see <link><linkText>Learn Hadoop in HDInsight using the HDInsight Getting Started Gallery</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the samples in the Getting Started gallery, see <link><linkText>Learn Hadoop in HDInsight using the HDInsight Getting Started Gallery</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To run the sample
trans-unit.target: To run the sample

trans-unit.source: From the Azure preview portal startboard, click the tile for the cluster you just created.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure preview portal startboard, click the tile for the cluster you just created.

trans-unit.source: On the new cluster blade, click Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: On the new cluster blade, click Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the admin username and password for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the admin username and password for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Launch cluster dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Launch cluster dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the webpage that opens, click the Getting Started Gallery tab, and then under the Solutions with Sample Data category, click the sample that you want to run.
trans-unit.target: From the webpage that opens, click the Getting Started Gallery tab, and then under the Solutions with Sample Data category, click the sample that you want to run.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on the Web page to finish the sample.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on the Web page to finish the sample.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists a couple of samples and provides more information about what each sample does.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists a couple of samples and provides more information about what each sample does.

trans-unit.source: Sample
trans-unit.target: Sample

trans-unit.source: What does it do?
trans-unit.target: What does it do?

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Sensor data analysis[hdinsight-sensor-data-sample]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Sensor data analysis[hdinsight-sensor-data-sample]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use HDInsight to process historical data that is produced by heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems to identify systems that are not able to reliably maintain a set temperature.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use HDInsight to process historical data that is produced by heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems to identify systems that are not able to reliably maintain a set temperature.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Website log analysis[hdinsight-weblogs-sample]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Website log analysis[hdinsight-weblogs-sample]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use HDInsight to analyze website log files to get insight into the frequency of visits to the website in a day from external websites, and a summary of website errors that the users experience.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use HDInsight to analyze website log files to get insight into the frequency of visits to the website in a day from external websites, and a summary of website errors that the users experience.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Twitter trend analysis</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Twitter trend analysis</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use HDInsight to analyze trends in Twitter.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use HDInsight to analyze trends in Twitter.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Run a Hive query from the portal
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Run a Hive query from the portal

trans-unit.source: Now that you have provisioned an HDInsight cluster, the next step is to run a Hive job to query a sample Hive table.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have provisioned an HDInsight cluster, the next step is to run a Hive job to query a sample Hive table.

trans-unit.source: We will use hivesampletable, which comes with HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: We will use hivesampletable, which comes with HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: The table contains data about mobile device manufacturers, platforms, and models.
trans-unit.target: The table contains data about mobile device manufacturers, platforms, and models.

trans-unit.source: A Hive query on this table retrieves data for mobile devices by a specific manufacturer.
trans-unit.target: A Hive query on this table retrieves data for mobile devices by a specific manufacturer.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio comes with the Azure SDK for .NET version 2.5 or later.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio comes with the Azure SDK for .NET version 2.5 or later.

trans-unit.source: By using the tools in Visual Studio, you can connect to HDInsight cluster, create Hive tables, and run Hive queries.
trans-unit.target: By using the tools in Visual Studio, you can connect to HDInsight cluster, create Hive tables, and run Hive queries.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio[1]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio[1]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To run a Hive job from the cluster dashboard
trans-unit.target: To run a Hive job from the cluster dashboard

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[azure-management-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[azure-management-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click HDINSIGHT from the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click HDINSIGHT from the left pane.

trans-unit.source: You will see a list of clusters, including the cluster you just created in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: You will see a list of clusters, including the cluster you just created in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the cluster that you want to use to run the Hive job, and then click QUERY CONSOLE at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the cluster that you want to use to run the Hive job, and then click QUERY CONSOLE at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: A webpage opens in a different browser tab.
trans-unit.target: A webpage opens in a different browser tab.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Hadoop user account and password.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Hadoop user account and password.

trans-unit.source: The default user name is admin; the password is what you entered while provisioning the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The default user name is admin; the password is what you entered while provisioning the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The dashboard looks like this:
trans-unit.target: The dashboard looks like this:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hive Editor tab in the HDInsight cluster dashboard.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hive Editor tab in the HDInsight cluster dashboard.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There are several tabs at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: There are several tabs at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: The default tab is Hive Editor, and the other tabs are Job History and File Browser.
trans-unit.target: The default tab is Hive Editor, and the other tabs are Job History and File Browser.

trans-unit.source: By using the dashboard, you can submit Hive queries, check Hadoop job logs, and browse files in storage.
trans-unit.target: By using the dashboard, you can submit Hive queries, check Hadoop job logs, and browse files in storage.

trans-unit.source: Note that the URL of the webpage is .azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: Note that the URL of the webpage is .azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: So instead of opening the dashboard from the portal, you can open the dashboard from a web browser by using the URL.
trans-unit.target: So instead of opening the dashboard from the portal, you can open the dashboard from a web browser by using the URL.

trans-unit.source: On the Hive Editor tab, for Query Name, enter HTC20.
trans-unit.target: On the Hive Editor tab, for Query Name, enter HTC20.

trans-unit.source: The query name is the job title.
trans-unit.target: The query name is the job title.

trans-unit.source: In the query pane, enter the Hive query as shown in the image:
trans-unit.target: In the query pane, enter the Hive query as shown in the image:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hive query entered in the query pane of the Hive Editor.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hive query entered in the query pane of the Hive Editor.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Submit.
trans-unit.target: Click Submit.

trans-unit.source: It takes a few moments to get the results back.
trans-unit.target: It takes a few moments to get the results back.

trans-unit.source: The screen refreshes every 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The screen refreshes every 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: You can also click Refresh to refresh the screen.
trans-unit.target: You can also click Refresh to refresh the screen.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Results from a Hive query in listed at the bottom of the cluster dashboard.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Results from a Hive query in listed at the bottom of the cluster dashboard.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the status shows that the job is completed, click the query name on the screen to see the output.
trans-unit.target: After the status shows that the job is completed, click the query name on the screen to see the output.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of Job Start Time (UTC).
trans-unit.target: Make a note of Job Start Time (UTC).

trans-unit.source: You will need it later.
trans-unit.target: You will need it later.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Job Start Time listed in the Job History tab of the HDInsight cluster dashboard.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Job Start Time listed in the Job History tab of the HDInsight cluster dashboard.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The page also shows the Job Output and the Job Log.
trans-unit.target: The page also shows the Job Output and the Job Log.

trans-unit.source: You also have the option to download the output file (\_stdout) and the log file \(_stderr).
trans-unit.target: You also have the option to download the output file (\_stdout) and the log file \(_stderr).

trans-unit.source: To browse to the output file
trans-unit.target: To browse to the output file

trans-unit.source: On the cluster dashboard, click File Browser.
trans-unit.target: On the cluster dashboard, click File Browser.

trans-unit.source: Click your storage account name, click your container name (which is the same as your cluster name), and then click user.
trans-unit.target: Click your storage account name, click your container name (which is the same as your cluster name), and then click user.

trans-unit.source: Click admin and then click the GUID that has the last modified time (a little after the job start time you noted earlier).
trans-unit.target: Click admin and then click the GUID that has the last modified time (a little after the job start time you noted earlier).

trans-unit.source: Copy this GUID.
trans-unit.target: Copy this GUID.

trans-unit.source: You will need it in the next section.
trans-unit.target: You will need it in the next section.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>The Hive query output file GUID listed in the File Browser tab.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>The Hive query output file GUID listed in the File Browser tab.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Connect to Microsoft business intelligence tools for Excel
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Connect to Microsoft business intelligence tools for Excel

trans-unit.source: You can use the Power Query add-in for Microsoft Excel to import the job output from HDInsight into Excel, where Microsoft business intelligence tools can be used to further analyze the results.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Power Query add-in for Microsoft Excel to import the job output from HDInsight into Excel, where Microsoft business intelligence tools can be used to further analyze the results.

trans-unit.source: You must have Excel 2013 or 2010 installed to complete this part of the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You must have Excel 2013 or 2010 installed to complete this part of the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To download Microsoft Power Query for Excel
trans-unit.target: To download Microsoft Power Query for Excel

trans-unit.source: Download Microsoft Power Query for Microsoft Excel from the <link><linkText>Microsoft Download Center</linkText><title></title></link> and install it.
trans-unit.target: Download Microsoft Power Query for Microsoft Excel from the <link><linkText>Microsoft Download Center</linkText><title></title></link> and install it.

trans-unit.source: To import HDInsight data
trans-unit.target: To import HDInsight data

trans-unit.source: Open Excel, and create a new workbook.
trans-unit.target: Open Excel, and create a new workbook.

trans-unit.source: Click the Power Query menu, click From Other Sources, and then click From Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Click the Power Query menu, click From Other Sources, and then click From Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Excel PowerQuery Import menu open for Azure HDInsight.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Excel PowerQuery Import menu open for Azure HDInsight.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the Account Name of the Azure Blob Storage account that is associated with your cluster, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Account Name of the Azure Blob Storage account that is associated with your cluster, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: (This is the storage account you created earlier in the tutorial.)
trans-unit.target: (This is the storage account you created earlier in the tutorial.)

trans-unit.source: Enter the Account Key for the Azure Blob Storage account, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Account Key for the Azure Blob Storage account, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: In the right pane, double-click the blob name.
trans-unit.target: In the right pane, double-click the blob name.

trans-unit.source: By default the blob name is the same as the cluster name.
trans-unit.target: By default the blob name is the same as the cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Locate stdout in the Name column.
trans-unit.target: Locate stdout in the Name column.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the GUID in the corresponding Folder Path column matches the GUID you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the GUID in the corresponding Folder Path column matches the GUID you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: A match suggests that the output data corresponds to the job you submitted.
trans-unit.target: A match suggests that the output data corresponds to the job you submitted.

trans-unit.source: Click Binary in the column left of stdout.
trans-unit.target: Click Binary in the column left of stdout.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Finding the data output by GUID in the list of content.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Finding the data output by GUID in the list of content.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Close & Load in the upper-left corner to import the Hive job output into Excel.
trans-unit.target: Click Close & Load in the upper-left corner to import the Hive job output into Excel.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this Hadoop tutorial, you learned how to provision a Hadoop cluster on Windows in HDInsight, run a Hive query on data, and import the results into Excel, where they can be further processed and graphically displayed with business intelligence tools.
trans-unit.target: In this Hadoop tutorial, you learned how to provision a Hadoop cluster on Windows in HDInsight, run a Hive query on data, and import the results into Excel, where they can be further processed and graphically displayed with business intelligence tools.
